info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 5:38AM CDT until July 15 at 1:24AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Colorado River Near San Saba affecting Lampasas and San Saba Counties.
For the Colorado River...including San Saba...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Colorado River near San Saba.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur. Secondary roads and low water crossings will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 30.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Monday was 30.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.1 feet on 04/29/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
